017package org.apache.juneau.commons.reflect;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.*;
020import java.util.*;
021
022import org.apache.juneau.commons.utils.*;
023
024/**
025 * Encapsulates type variable implementations for a class hierarchy.
026 *
027 * <p>
028 * This class provides a type-safe wrapper around type variable implementations,
029 * using {@link List} instead of arrays for better API consistency.
030 *
031 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
032 * <p class='bjava'>
033 *    <jc>// Given class hierarchy:</jc>
034 *    <jk>public static class</jk> BeanA&lt;T&gt; {
035 *       <jk>public</jk> T <jf>x</jf>;
036 *    }
037 *    <jk>public static class</jk> BeanB <jk>extends</jk> BeanA&lt;Integer&gt; {...}
038 *
039 *    <jc>// Create TypeVariables from BeanB</jc>
040 *    TypeVariables <jv>tv</jv> = TypeVariables.<jsm>of</jsm>(BeanB.<jk>class</jk>);
041 *
042 *    <jc>// Get the type variable implementation for BeanA</jc>
043 *    Class&lt;?&gt; <jv>impl</jv> = <jv>tv</jv>.get(BeanA.<jk>class</jk>, 0);  <jc>// Returns Integer.class</jc>
044 * </p>
045 *
046 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5>
047 * <ul>
048 *    <li>{@link #of(Type)}
049 * </ul>
050 */
051public class TypeVariables {
052
053   private final Map<Class<?>,List<Class<?>>> map;
054
055   /**
056    * Creates an empty TypeVariables instance.
057    *
058    * @return A new empty TypeVariables instance.
059    */
060   public static TypeVariables empty() {
061      return new TypeVariables(new LinkedHashMap<>());
062   }
063
064   /**
065    * Creates a TypeVariables instance from the specified type.
066    *
067    * <p>
068    * Recursively determines the classes represented by parameterized types in the class hierarchy of the specified
069    * type.
070    *
071    * <p>
072    * For example, given the following classes...
073    * <p class='bjava'>
074    *    <jk>public static class</jk> BeanA&lt;T&gt; {
075    *       <jk>public</jk> T <jf>x</jf>;
076    *    }
077    *    <jk>public static class</jk> BeanB <jk>extends</jk> BeanA&lt;Integer&gt; {...}
078    * </p>
079    * <p>
080    *    ...calling this method on {@code BeanB.class} will return a {@link TypeVariables} instance indicating
081    *    that the {@code T} parameter on the BeanA class is implemented with an {@code Integer}:
082    * <p class='bcode'>
083    *    {BeanA.class:[Integer.class]}
084    * </p>
085    *
086    * <h5 class='section'>Known Limitations:</h5>
087    * <p>
088    * This code doesn't currently properly handle the following situation with nested generic bounds:
089    * <p class='bjava'>
090    *    <jk>public static class</jk> BeanB&lt;T <jk>extends</jk> Number&gt; <jk>extends</jk> BeanA&lt;>;
091    *    <jk>public static class</jk> BeanC <jk>extends</jk> BeanB&lt;Integer&gt;;
092    * </p>
093    *
094    * <p>
095    * When called on {@code BeanC}, the type variable will be resolved as {@code Number}, not {@code Integer}.
096    * This limitation exists because the intermediate type parameter bound information is lost during type resolution
097    *
098    * @param type The type to analyze.
099    * @return A new TypeVariables instance.
100    */
101   public static TypeVariables of(Type type) {
102      Map<Class<?>, List<Class<?>>> m = new LinkedHashMap<>();
103      findTypeVarImpls(type, m);
104      return fromMap(m);
105   }
106
107   /**
108    * Recursively determines the classes represented by parameterized types in the class hierarchy.
109    *
110    * @param t The type we're recursing.
111    * @param m Where the results are loaded.
112    */
113   private static void findTypeVarImpls(Type t, Map<Class<?>, List<Class<?>>> m) {
114      if (t instanceof Class<?> c) {
115         findTypeVarImpls(c.getGenericSuperclass(), m);
116         for (var ci : c.getGenericInterfaces())
117            findTypeVarImpls(ci, m);
118      } else if (t instanceof ParameterizedType t2) {
119         var rt = t2.getRawType();
120         if (rt instanceof Class<?> rt2) {
121            var gImpls = t2.getActualTypeArguments();
122            var gTypes = new ArrayList<Class<?>>(gImpls.length);
123            for (var gt : gImpls) {
124               if (gt instanceof Class<?> c)
125                  gTypes.add(c);
126               else if (gt instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
127                  for (var upperBound : tv.getBounds())
128                     if (upperBound instanceof Class upperBound2) {
129                        gTypes.add(upperBound2);
130                        break;
131                     }
132               }
133            }
134            m.put(rt2, gTypes);
135            findTypeVarImpls(t2.getRawType(), m);
136         }
137      }
138   }
139
140   /**
141    * Creates a TypeVariables instance from a map of lists.
142    *
143    * <p>
144    * Package-private factory method for internal use.
145    *
146    * @param map The map of class to type variable implementations.
147    * @return A new TypeVariables instance.
148    */
149   static TypeVariables fromMap(Map<Class<?>, List<Class<?>>> map) {
150      return new TypeVariables(map);
151   }
152
153   /**
154    * Constructor.
155    *
156    * @param map The map of class to type variable implementations.
157    */
158   TypeVariables(Map<Class<?>, List<Class<?>>> map) {
159      this.map = map;
160   }
161
162   /**
163    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this instance contains type variable implementations for the specified class.
164    *
165    * @param clazz The class to check.
166    * @return <jk>true</jk> if type variable implementations exist for the class.
167    */
168   public boolean containsKey(Class<?> clazz) {
169      return map.containsKey(clazz);
170   }
171
172   /**
173    * Returns the list of type variable implementations for the specified class.
174    *
175    * @param clazz The class to get type variable implementations for.
176    * @return The list of type variable implementations, or <jk>null</jk> if not found.
177    */
178   public List<Class<?>> get(Class<?> clazz) {
179      return map.get(clazz);
180   }
181
182   /**
183    * Returns the type variable implementation at the specified index for the given class.
184    *
185    * @param clazz The class to get the type variable implementation for.
186    * @param index The zero-based index of the type variable.
187    * @return The type variable implementation, or <jk>null</jk> if not found or index is out of bounds.
188    */
189   public Class<?> get(Class<?> clazz, int index) {
190      var list = map.get(clazz);
191      if (list == null || index < 0 || index >= list.size())
192         return null;
193      return list.get(index);
194   }
195
196   /**
197    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this instance is empty (contains no type variable implementations).
198    *
199    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this instance is empty.
200    */
201   public boolean isEmpty() {
202      return map.isEmpty();
203   }
204
205   /**
206    * Returns the number of classes with type variable implementations.
207    *
208    * @return The number of classes.
209    */
210   public int size() {
211      return map.size();
212   }
213
214   /**
215    * Converts a {@link Type} to a {@link Class} if possible.
216    *
217    * <p>
218    * This method resolves generic types, parameterized types, generic arrays, and type variables
219    * to their concrete class representations.
220    *
221    * <h5 class='section'>Type Resolution:</h5>
222    * <ul>
223    *    <li><b>Class</b> - Returns the class as-is
224    *    <li><b>ParameterizedType</b> - Returns the raw type class
225    *    <li><b>GenericArrayType</b> - Creates and returns the array class
226    *    <li><b>TypeVariable</b> - Resolves using type variable implementations, or returns <jk>null</jk> if not found
227    * </ul>
228    *
229    * @param t The type to resolve.
230    * @return The resolved class, or <jk>null</jk> if the type cannot be resolved to a class.
231    */
232   public Class<?> resolve(Type t) {
233      if (t instanceof Class<?> c)
234         return c;
235
236      if (t instanceof ParameterizedType pt)
237         // A parameter (e.g. <String>.
238         return (Class<?>)pt.getRawType();
239
240      if (t instanceof GenericArrayType gat) {
241         // An array parameter (e.g. <byte[]>).
242         var gatct = gat.getGenericComponentType();
243
244         if (gatct instanceof Class<?> gatct2)
245            return Array.newInstance(gatct2, 0).getClass();
246
247         if (gatct instanceof ParameterizedType gatct3)
248            return Array.newInstance((Class<?>)gatct3.getRawType(), 0).getClass();
249
250         if (gatct instanceof GenericArrayType gatct4) {
251            var resolved = resolve(gatct4);
252            return resolved != null ? Array.newInstance(resolved, 0).getClass() : null;
253         }
254
255         return null;
256
257      } else if (t instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
258         String varName = tv.getName();
259         int varIndex = -1;
260         var gc = (Class<?>)tv.getGenericDeclaration();
261         TypeVariable<?>[] tvv = gc.getTypeParameters();
262         for (var i = 0; i < tvv.length; i++) {
263            if (tvv[i].getName().equals(varName)) {
264               varIndex = i;
265            }
266         }
267         if (varIndex != -1) {
268            // If we couldn't find a type variable implementation, that means
269            // the type was defined at runtime (e.g. Bean b = new Bean<Foo>();)
270            // in which case the type is lost through erasure.
271            // Assume java.lang.Object as the type.
272            return get(gc, varIndex);
273         }
274      }
275      return null;
276   }
277
278   /**
279    * Static convenience method to resolve a type using type variable implementations.
280    *
281    * <p>
282    * This method can resolve types even when {@code typeVars} is <jk>null</jk> for non-type-variable types
283    * (e.g., {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}).
284    * For {@link TypeVariable} types, {@code typeVars} must not be <jk>null</jk>.
285    *
286    * @param type The type to resolve.
287    * @param typeVars The type variable implementations, or <jk>null</jk>.
288    * @return The resolved class, or <jk>null</jk> if the type cannot be resolved.
289    */
290   public static Class<?> resolve(Type type, TypeVariables typeVars) {
291      if (type instanceof Class<?> c)
292         return c;
293
294      if (type instanceof ParameterizedType pt)
295         return (Class<?>)pt.getRawType();
296
297      if (type instanceof GenericArrayType gat) {
298         var gatct = gat.getGenericComponentType();
299
300         if (gatct instanceof Class<?> gatct2)
301            return Array.newInstance(gatct2, 0).getClass();
302
303         if (gatct instanceof ParameterizedType gatct3)
304            return Array.newInstance((Class<?>)gatct3.getRawType(), 0).getClass();
305
306         if (gatct instanceof GenericArrayType gatct4) {
307            var resolved = resolve(gatct4, typeVars);
308            return resolved != null ? Array.newInstance(resolved, 0).getClass() : null;
309         }
310
311         return null;
312      }
313
314      if (type instanceof TypeVariable<?> tv) {
315         if (typeVars == null)
316            return null;
317         return typeVars.resolve(tv);
318      }
319
320      return null;
321   }
322}
323
